page.title: 01HENLLAN: AN INTRODUCTION
page.content: The surveyed block is a lightly- populated rural area of intensive pasture and woodland on the north- western edge of the borough of Denbigh It contains a dozen scattered farms and the settlement of Henllan which has some 700 inhabitants. Henllan is c.150m. above sea level. It derives its name thus: 'Hen'(Welsh) = 'ancient'; 'Llan'(Welsh)= an enclosure fortified against wild animals or enemy tribes. 'Llan'also means'parish',and the local church was first founded in the 6thC. when St.Sadwrn,Priest Confessor,made his home there. The village has a general store cum post office, a single public house, 3 agricultural depots,a church and two Methodist chapels. It is a socially- active community,however,with its own Council and several village societies.
